item.title: IT ramblings
item.description: There is going to be an interesting event soon in Lviv both for those who are in IT and those who love to use and improve their english. It‚Äôs called IT Ramblings. Follow the link and check it out. I‚Äôm definitely coming, join in üòâ

item.title: :? = (think)
item.description: Yess and BTW its the Skype shortcut. While on thinking mood guess what would the ‚Äòtelemonision‚Äô or here in Ukraine ‚Äòtelemonizor‚Äô would mean? You guessed it right ‚Äì a monitor, which has a capability to be come an TV. Why would one need such a thing ‚Äì I dunno, but lots and lots of people here want it. I suppose they think that in this way they would spend less money ‚Äì but hey ‚Äì you would have none: no monitor would be a good TV and no TV would suit you as a nice fast-response monitor, UNLESS it costs more then 2 of them bought separately.

item.title: Femen must have been doing that right.
item.description: Now seriously smth HAS to be done about Ukrainian girls reputation in Europe and generally throughout the world. Now I can‚Äôt speak for whole Ukraine but it seems to me that at least Western Ukraine girls are not that money-loving. Today walking to work I saw this

item.title: Flu, people and ukrainian healthcare system
item.description: THEY ALL SUCK!!! a big deal.I will start with the last one. Having just recovered from the flu I decided to go to the hospital in order to check if I‚Äôve totally recovered and that there is nothing ‚Äúunder the hood‚Äù which would strike me in the back in few days. The normal procedure here is to have a blood analysis and a few more tests. Step one ‚Äì find the doctor.

item.title: Ukrainian independence day.
item.description: It&#8217;s funny sometimes how could absolutely non-officially connected news be linked together so tightly that one couldn&#8217;t even imagine. Today, reading the daily news I came across an article describing the Barack Obama&#8217;s attitude towards Ukrainian <span style="font-family: -webkit-monospace;"><span style="-webkit-border-horizontal-spacing: 2px; -webkit-border-vertical-spacing: 2px;"><span style="font-family: 'Times New Roman';"><span style="-webkit-border-horizontal-spacing: 0px; -webkit-border-vertical-spacing: 0px;">sovereignty along with greetings regarding this year&#8217;s independence day. Between the other it was stated there that &#8220;USA won&#8217;t abandon Ukraine on its way towards democratic future&#8230;&#8221;.

item.title: How do they do it?
item.description: It often happens that you have smth. to share with the rest of the world, but you do not have time for it.

item.title: Ukrainians on Times.
item.description: Today visited Times. Was interested in one article about (RU+GBR)/UA. To hell the article. I read the comments. OMG.

item.title: Who the hell is ‚ÄúNext In‚Äù?
item.description: Recently found myself registered in this wierd system Next In. The most interesting part is I‚Äôve never made any registrations on this site at all! Looks like those guys‚Äôve just stolen public info from famous sites like Linked-In. If anyone comes across this one don‚Äôt trust any info they give ‚Äì ‚Äòcase started by stealing i think they will go further. Just want to make official notice of that I have no relation to info that can be found there.
